channel.title: Physics Help - Need help asap
channel.description:
I have a few questions that I'm not sure on how to do:
1) A 20kg mass is connected to a 8kg mass by a thin frictionless string on a pulley. It accelerates to 1.5m/s2 and the heavier mass slides along a rough surface. What is the coefficient of friction?
3) 1.00g of U-238 fuel is consumed. Assuming 100% efficiency, what is the nuclear energy used in joules?
4) A 7.5x10^3kg sattelite orbits a planet at an altitude of 300km. The radius of the planet is 8.5x10^6. The gravitational field at the radius is 6.5N/kg. What is the mass of the planet?
5)A rocket car uniformly accelterates at 15m/s2 and heads towards a cliff that is 75m high. At what distance should the landing pad be placed so the car can land?
Need help with these questions ASAP.. Thanks.

item.title: Physics Help - Need help asap
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Meh, I can tell you that it’s impossible to answer the final question, because you don’t know the speed the car is traveling at when it starts accelerating, nor the distance/time it accelerates for.

Read full topic

item.title: Physics Help - Need help asap
item.dc:creator: @nade nade
item.description:
@nade wrote:

1.00g of U-238 fuel is consumed. Assuming 100% efficiency, what is the nuclear energy used in joules?

You phrased the question pretty badly. I assume you are looking for energy released during nuclear fission. In this case you need to find the nuclear binding energy…?

You can calculate Mass Defect (Mass of reactants[u238+nuetron] - Mass of products[daughter nucleus ect…]) for one atom then calculate energy.
Use e=mc^2

Read full topic

item.description:
@Scarf4ce wrote:

I have a few questions that I’m not sure on how to do:

  1. A 20kg mass is connected to a 8kg mass by a thin frictionless string on a pulley. It accelerates to 1.5m/s2 and the heavier mass slides along a rough surface. What is the coefficient of friction?

  2. 1.00g of U-238 fuel is consumed. Assuming 100% efficiency, what is the nuclear energy used in joules?

  3. A 7.5x10^3kg sattelite orbits a planet at an altitude of 300km. The radius of the planet is 8.5x10^6. The gravitational field at the radius is 6.5N/kg. What is the mass of the planet?

5)A rocket car uniformly accelterates at 15m/s2 and heads towards a cliff that is 75m high. At what distance should the landing pad be placed so the car can land?

Need help with these questions ASAP… Thanks.
